Create a "before and after" photo montage of your hiking journey to showcase your progress and transformation. This can help you visualize your growth and see how far you've come, which can help alleviate feelings of jealousy towards others.

Write a blog post or journal entry about your hiking experience, detailing your struggles, triumphs, and lessons learned. Sharing your journey with others can help you feel more connected and inspired by the community of hikers who are also working towards their goals.

Engage in a "hiking buddy" system with a friend or family member. This way, you can have someone to share your experiences with and support each other through the journey. It can also help you feel more motivated and accountable.

Take a break from social media and technology during your hike. This can help you focus on your own journey and avoid comparing yourself to others. You can also use this time to disconnect from the pressures of society and connect with nature.

Create a "hiking bucket list" of places you want to visit and goals you want to achieve. This can help you stay focused on your own journey and give you something to work towards. You can also use this as a way to celebrate your accomplishments and feel proud of yourself.
